articles.description: Amber Group Financial Problems Amber Group, an Asia crypto firm, seems to have liquidity problems according to on-chain analysis. Amber’s asset management platform WhaleFin and CeDeFi lending protocol Clearpool are the two related firms/borrowers that might be affected by Amber’s shortage of funds. (source:
articles.title: Today in DeFi - Amber Group Financial Problems, Tessera Live, Automated Strategies, and More...

articles.author: 𝕯𝖆𝖓𝖌𝖊𝖗
articles.description: Maple Cuts Orthogonal Orthogonal Trading, a crypto firm that has funds stuck on FTX, and is also a significant borrower on lending protocol Maple Finance, has defaulted on eight loans totalling $36 million on Maple. Creditor M11 Credit issued a default notice to Orthogonal for its loans, while Maple severed all ties with Orthogonal for misrepresenting its financial position.
articles.title: Today in DeFi - Maple Cuts Orthogonal, APE Staking Live, Lending on BnB Chain, and More...

articles.author: 𝕯𝖆𝖓𝖌𝖊𝖗
articles.description: Ankr aBNBc Exploit BnB chain node operator Ankr suffered a governance key compromise. The attacker d deployed a malicious contract to mint a very large amount of aBNBc, Ankr’s reward-bearing staked BNB token, and profited ~$7m by dumping what he minted.
articles.title: Today in DeFi - Ankr aBNB Exploit, Fantom Gas Monetization, Explore Delta Neutral Strategies, and More...

LINK Staking Update Chainlink is launching staking v0.1 on Dec. 6th. Stakers will be locking their funds til the planned launch of v0.2 (in 9-12 months) when the funds can be unlocked or migrated.
articles.title: Today in DeFi - Uniswap NFT Aggregator, LINK Staking Update, Trading Options on Arbitrum, and More...

BracketX Live on Arbitrum Structured product protocol BracketX is live on Arbitrum. BracketX is one of Bracket Protocol’s products, providing
articles.title: Today in DeFi - Phantom to Support Ethereum, Polygon, BracketX Live on Arbitrum, Borrowing on Arbitrum, and More...

articles.author: 𝕯𝖆𝖓𝖌𝖊𝖗
articles.description: Aave Freezes V2 Markets Aave governance has temporarily frozen 17 lending markets on V2 to fend off further liquidity attacks. Paused markets include YFI, CRV, ZRX, MANA, 1INCH, MKR, etc. AdaSwap Live on Cardano Mainnet Cardano-based DEX Adaswap is now live on mainnet, enabling trading & bridging for Cardano tokens and NFTs.
articles.title: Today in DeFi - Aave Freezes V2 Markets, AdaSwap Live on Cardano, Trading NFT Perps, and More...

articles.description: Product Launches 🚀 nftperp Beta Live NFT derivative protocol nftperp launches closed beta for whitelisted users, with PUNK/ETH and BAYC/ETH pairs live for trading. Tranchess on Ethereum & qETH Live BnB-based yield protocol Tranchess expands to Ethereum with its own ETH staking product qETH live for stakers to earn yield.
articles.title: Last Week in DeFi - nftperp Beta Live, Binance Industry Recovery Initiative, Pendle V2 AMM, and More...

articles.author: 𝕯𝖆𝖓𝖌𝖊𝖗
articles.description: Binance Industry Recovery Initiative Binance led a $1b Industry Recovery Initiative (IRI) to fund web3 developments. Third-party firms and ventures including Jump Crypto, Aptos Labs, Polygon Ventures, Animoca Brands, GSR, Kronos, and Brooker Group have joined and contributed another $50m to the co-investment.
articles.title: Today in DeFi - Binance Recovery Fund, Pendle V2 AMM, Trading BTC/ETH Volatility, and More...

articles.author: 𝕯𝖆𝖓𝖌𝖊𝖗
articles.description: Ape NFTs Marketplace Live A white-label marketplace for ApeCoin DAO, built by Snag Solutions, launches today. The marketplace will sell BAYC, MAYC, BAKC, and Otherdeed NFTs. Fees charged on sellers will be 5% on ETH sales and .25% on APE, and a full .25% of each sale is held in a multi-sig to fund DAO initiatives.
articles.title: Today in DeFi - Ape NFTs Marketplace Live, Volmex V2 Live on Polygon, L2 Lending, and More...

articles.author: 𝕯𝖆𝖓𝖌𝖊𝖗
articles.description: crvUSD Whitepaper Curve team releases the code and whitepaper for its stablecoin crvUSD. Curve stablecoin will be overcollateralized with crypto assets and will rely on the Lending-Liquidating AMM (LLAMMA) algorithm to manage potential collateralization risks.
articles.title: Today in DeFi - crvUSD Whitepaper, Ankr Supports Sui, Intro to Polynomial, and More...

articles.author: 𝕯𝖆𝖓𝖌𝖊𝖗
articles.description: Ren to Sunset 1.0 While working on the 2.0, Ren will sunset its 1.0 within 30 days. Ren-assets holders are recommended to redeem their assets to avoid potential damage/fund loss. rETH as DAI Collateral MakerDAO has deployed rETH (RocketPool staked ETH) as a new collateral type to generate DAI. The rETH-A vault has the min. collateral ratio of 170%, a 1.5% stability fee, and a 5m DAI debt ceiling.
articles.title: Today in DeFi - Ren to Sunset 1.0, rETH as DAI Collateral, Intro to Quoll Finance, and More...

articles.author: 𝕯𝖆𝖓𝖌𝖊𝖗
articles.description: Recap: Week of Nov. 14th
articles.title: Last Week in DeFi - LemmaSwap Live on Optimism, Atom 2.0 Rejected, Ren 2.0 Announced, and More...

articles.author: 𝕯𝖆𝖓𝖌𝖊𝖗
articles.description: Trove Supports Arbitrum Nova Trove, the NFT marketplace built around TreasureDAO ecosystem, now supports GameFi projects built on Arbitrum Nova, a gaming and social app-focused L2. Uniswap Permit2 & Universal Router Uniswap launches two infrastructure contracts: Permit2 that allows token approvals to be shared and managed across dApps; Universal Router that unifies ERC20 and NFT swapping into a single swap router.
articles.title: Today in DeFi - Trove Supports Arbitrum Nova, Uniswap Permit2 & Universal Router, Intro to LemmaSwap, and More...

articles.author: 𝕯𝖆𝖓𝖌𝖊𝖗
articles.description: LemmaSwap V2 Live on Optimism Lemma launches a new swap protocol on Optimism. LemmaSwap allows traders to execute spot swaps using Perpetual Protocol’s liquidity and allows LPs to earn yield from spot trading fees and funding rate PnL. USDV Depeg USDV, the stablecoin on the Velas chain, lost over 99% of its value after a 10B token dump on the Velas-based DEX WagyuSwap.
articles.title: Today in DeFi - LemmaSwap V2 Live, USDV Depeg, Intro to BendDAO, and More...

articles.author: 𝕯𝖆𝖓𝖌𝖊𝖗
articles.description: Genesis Lending Halts Withdrawals As part of the fallout from FTX, Genesis Trading has halted withdrawals of its lending product. This may have ramifications for Gemini’s Earn program, which uses Genesis. Maker DAI Teleport Maker launches Teleport - infrastructure for projects to utilize and transfer DAI across multichains. Maker also set up a 19k DAI integration grant for developers to create a front end for this back end technology.
articles.title: Today in DeFi - Genesis Halts Withdrawals, Maker Teleport, Intro to Bebop, and More...

articles.author: 𝕯𝖆𝖓𝖌𝖊𝖗
articles.description: Atom 2.0 Rejected The vote for Proposal 82 (Atom 2.0) vote has been rejected. The proposal called for a number of radical changes including Social Coordination Technology Interchain Security, Liquid Staking, as well as changes to issuance(potentially what caused the contention).
articles.title: Today in DeFi - Atom 2.0 Rejected, Nike NFTs Coming to Polygon, Intro to Sentiment.xyz, and More...

articles.author: 𝕯𝖆𝖓𝖌𝖊𝖗
articles.description: Recap: Week of Nov. 7th
articles.title: Last Week in DeFi - FTX Aftermath, MetaMask Bridges, Aptos x Google Cloud, and More...

articles.author: 𝕯𝖆𝖓𝖌𝖊𝖗
articles.description: Aptos x Google Cloud Google Cloud will validate nodes and participate on the Aptos mainnet, and Aptos blockchain will also be indexed and made available on Google Cloud's BigQuery service. Both parties are also set to launch an accelerator program as well as co-host a hackathon.
articles.title: Today in DeFi - Aptos x Google Cloud, DFX Reentrancy Exploit, WooFi Arbitrum Farming, and More...

articles.author: 𝕯𝖆𝖓𝖌𝖊𝖗
articles.description: FTX Situation Update Today Binance stated it will not pursue the FTX deal due to their DD. Primary holdings of FTX/Alameda (besides stables) include $FTT, SOL, SRM, BIT, xSUSHI, LDO, etc. and investments of FTX ventures include $NEAR, APE, APT, MINA, HNT, etc
articles.title: Today in DeFi - FTX Situation, MetaMask Bridges, Intro to Grizzly, and More...
